creator: danielc@analysisandsolutions.com
text:
I've been running 1.3 as a non-privileged user on my Windows 2000 machine for
years without incident.  I just upgraded to 2.x (2.2.2) the other day.  It
starts fine if the "Log On" "user" is system, but the service won't start if I
switch "This account" to the non-privileged user I was using for 1.3.  Here are
the error dialog boxes:

vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
httpd.exe - Application Error

The instruction at "0x6eec38bc" referenced memory at "0x00000000". The memory
could not be "read".

I then hit "cancel" to debug...
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
vs7jit.exe - Application Error

The application failed to initialize properly (0xc0000142).
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

The file permissions on the install directory are correct.

sorry; my bad - you can't manage the server, it should run as an unprivilaged
user.  But this is likely to be a perms problem with either the logs\ directory
(must be writeable) or similar (cache files etc).
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text: Guidance to set logs/ to writable by the unprivilaged account.  closing.
